definitions.definition: The art of using language, especially public speaking, as a means to persuade.
Meaningless language with an exaggerated style intended to impress.
Part of or similar to rhetoric, the use of language as a means to persuade.
definitions.example: A rhetorical question is one used merely to make a point, with no response expected.

definitions.definition: Not earnest, or presented only for the purpose of an argument.
